resources.string: File Shuttle provides cross-border file access and makes managing files inside Island much easier. It requires manual permission granting with ADB via USB-connected PC to activate.

File Shuttle of Island provides cross-border file access via Android \"Storage Access Framework\". But not all apps in the wild (even some popular file manage apps) support SAF.\n\nFX File Explorer has full support for SAF, just clone and launch it inside Island, select \"Connect to Storage\" in drop-down menu. The File Shuttle of Island is in the side menu.

Restrict ADB (Android Debugging Bridge) shell from executing dangerous commands (install APK, change settings and etc.).\n\nIf Mainland is also managed by Island, this could protect the whole device (including data sniffing or sneaky app installation via USB cable from physically connected external device).
Take control of ALL apps (in both Island and Mainland) and benefit from exclusive features. (more details in online guide)
Automatically freeze selected apps if not in active use, after screen goes off.
Enable cross-border image access for app not supporting \"Storage Access Framework\", provided it supports photo capture with external camera app.
App Ops is a powerful tool to selectively block some data access capabilities of apps gracefully, even if related permission is granted by user.

"Island" is a sandbox environment to clone selected apps and isolate them from accessing your personal data outside (including call logs, contacts and etc) even if permissions are granted. 

Cloned app runs parallel aside from the installed one with its separate copy of app data. It can also be frozen on demand, with launcher icon vanished and its background behaviors completely blocked. 

By creating the sandbox environment, you authorize Island to act as device administrator of "Android for Work", with the privilege to manage the sandbox environment. Island never collect data related to your privacy, please read our privacy policy on Google Play Store for more details.
Sorry, the required feature \"Managed Profile\" is not supported on this device.

Island setup is incomplete, the previous attempt might be unsuccessful.\n\nIf your device ROM or 3rd-party tool enforce auto-start control (or similar background-restriction functionality), please whitelist Island in related settings, then continue the setup.
Sorry, Island cannot be setup due to device currently being managed by %1$s.
Sorry, the required \"Android for Work\" feature may not be fully supported on your device.

Trouble setting-up Island?

If you got error message during the setup procedure of Island, please continue to open the online troubleshooting guide with suggested solutions.

If all the solutions do not work and your device is rooted, you can alternatively setup Island with root.
No apps here.\nPlease switch to other view.
For advanced user:\nThis limitation could also be circumvented with one-time manual setup via USB-connected PC.
Sorry, Island cannot clone apps without a proper built-in app market on your device (preferable Google Play Store) until Android 5.1. Please refer to the FAQ for solutions.

To save memory and avoid unnecessary battery consumption, Island has no background services in design. Instead it delegates the automatic freezing job to Greenify, taking advantage of its sophisticated automatic hibernation management.
Greenify needs to be upgraded to a newer version.
Island was unexpectedly deactivated, please grant the Device Admin permission to re-activate.
Are you sure you want to destroy the whole Island? You will LOSE ALL THE DATA IN ISLAND.\n\nDon\'t worry, apps and data outside Island will NEVER be affected.
In the current Mainland setup, you cannot re-create Island space unless the control for Mainland is rescinded.\n\nAre you sure you still want to destroy the Island?
Are you sure to rescind?\n\nYou will have to go through the setup flow again to bring it back, that means Island space and all accounts must be removed first if your device is not rooted.
To remove the whole Island space, please open system \"Settings - Accounts\" and select \"Remove work profile\".

This app (or component) is critical for the Android system or other apps to work properly. If proceed, some apps or the whole system may become unstable or malfunctional.\n\nDo you really want to proceed?
This system app (or component) is not installed for some reason. If proceed, the whole system may become unstable or malfunctional.\n\nDo you really want to proceed?
Device Admin privilege is required to manage Mainland.
Sorry, something went wrong in Island setup. (stage %1$d)

System app can only be disabled. It\'s similar to the removal of an installed app.\n\nIsland has no privilege to do that, instead you will be redirected to the system settings app, there you can click the \"DISABLE\" button to proceed.
Island setup in progress, please wait…
Sorry, an internal error occurred, please restart this app and try again.
Storage permission is required to access the shared storage from within Island.
Sorry, there\'s an error launching this app.
Operation failed.\n(probably due to ROM compatibility)
Use different badge for app launch shortcuts in Mainland and Island.\n(May not work on some devices)
Add prefix to shortcut label when app is frozen, and remove the prefix when app is unfrozen.\n(May not work on some launchers)
Extra info in \"Action not allowed\" dialog
Show Island-specific extra information in the \"Action not allowed\" system dialog.
Preserve permission supervision for frozen apps
Android system does not preserve the permission supervision (a.k.a. App Ops) settings (e.g. \"background restriction\", \"show above other apps\") for frozen apps, let Island do that for you.
\n\n(ADB shell is only required for one-time setup)
Please run this command in ADB shell:

Apps in Island cannot access your private data and apps in Mainland (e.g. contacts, call log, photos, documents) except device global data: (including but not limited to) 

· Device identifiers (forbidden on Android 10+)
· SMS
· Device location

On Android 9+, the above exceptions can also be restricted by supervising the permission of apps (overriding the granted state of permissions).\n\nIf permission is revoked here, app could never gain access to the private data protected by that permission, even if you explicitly grant the permission in the app.
Read device identity and telephony state
Revoking it also affect the ability of app to check telephony state
Also affect the ability to scan near-by devices
CAUTION: Revoking may cause app to crash
Are you sure to revoke this permission for all user apps (system apps excluded)?
Grant cross-land privilege to apps with this capability.
Some system apps may be always privileged despite this setting
Shortcut to deactivate Island, ceasing all the background activities inside. Island can then be activated on-demand by launching any of the apps inside.
Shortcut to freeze app recently unfrozen and revoke permissions temporarily granted.
This may help to fix some issues. All apps and data will be preserved.
Remove this Island, together with all apps inside and their data.
Rescind the privilege on Mainland. All your apps and data will be intact (unfrozen), but you could no longer:\n\n
· Freeze apps in Mainland\n· Supervise app permissions in Mainland (Android 9+)\n· Use some device global features (e.g. full ADB Secure).
Welcome to visit us on GitHub
Ask for security confirmation before disabling?
Security confirmation is required to disable.
Do you want to disable this feature?
Failed to verify, please try again.
Once frozen, the app in Island will vanish until being explicit unfrozen.\n\nApp could do absolutely nothing in frozen state.

App in mainland can be cloned into Island.\n\nThe clone acts as a newly installed instance and has its own data, separated from its mainland twin. They only share the executable binaries to conserve space.
\"%1$s\" is a critical system component required inside Island for Android system to work properly.\n\nTake action now to avoid unexpected app or system malfunction.
